page.title: 02Roads of the Beechdale Est.
page.content: The Beechdale Estate is defined by a network of roads important in both local and national terms.The west of the estate is bounded by the M6 Motorway,which has the dubious distinction of having one of the highest traffic densities in the country.This is the major traffic route from the South and the West to the North West and Scotland. The Estate is split into two by the only route from the M6 to the industrial estate.This residential road,often busy with Class 2 Heavy Goods Vehicles,also provides much of the Estate with its most practical means of access to the amenities of the area.The traffic flow of the road often exceeds at peak perids two thousand vehicles per hour.
